comments.body: @shrinath-suresh what's the difference between this example (example2) and example1? Could we include just one or the other?

Also, is this example adapted from an existing Pytorch Lightning example somewhere? Maybe we could reference the existing example code, and mention ("This example is adapted from ... with only minor tweaks, i.e. the addition of an `mlflow.pytorch.autolog` call to add automatic instrumentation of training code")

> @shrinath-suresh what's the difference between this example (example2) and example1? Could we include just one or the other?

Example 1 illustrates - EarlyStopping Behaviour, Model Checkpointing, Learning Rate Monitor
Example 2 illustrates - Logging every n iterations

> Also, is this example adapted from an existing Pytorch Lightning example somewhere? Maybe we could reference the existing example code, and mention ("This example is adapted from ... with only minor tweaks, i.e. the addition of an `mlflow.pytorch.autolog` call to add automatic instrumentation of training code")

sure. i will add a link to it

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@## MNIST example with MLFlow

In this example, we train a model to predict handwritten digits.The autolog code uses Pytorch Lightning's MLFlowLogger to log metrics.

comments.body:
```suggestion
In this example, we train a Pytorch Lightning model to predict handwritten digits. The code is almost entirely dedicated to model training, with the addition of a single ``mlflow.pytorch.autolog()`` call to enable automatic logging of params, metrics, and models from training. 
```

I think we could reword the overview as in the above suggestion^, including a link to the ``mlflow.pytorch.autolog`` API docs once the API is released (for users who want to learn more about its behavior and parameters, like the `log_every_n_iter` param)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1,5 @@## MNIST example with MLFlow

In this example, we train a model to predict handwritten digits.The autolog code uses Pytorch Lightning's MLFlowLogger to log metrics. 
The code is trained using pytorch lightning loop and the autolog function call in the main - `mlflow.pytorch.autolog()`
is responsible for logging the params, metrics, model summary and the model.

comments.body:
```suggestion
## Logging to a custom tracking server

To configure MLflow to log to a custom (non-default) tracking location, set the ``MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI`` environment variable, e.g. via  ``export MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://localhost:5000/``.  For more details, see [the docs](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#where-runs-are-recorded)
```

Could we reword this section as suggested? And move it to the end of the README? I think it'll only be relevant to a small number of readers

## Setting tracking URI
MLflow tracking URI can be set using the environment variable MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI
